Get Car Insurance without a License – Learn about recommended options for getting car insurance without a license, including being listed as an excluded driver or getting parked car insurance. Discover tips for finding insurers that provide policies to unlicensed drivers and maintaining comprehensive insurance while your license is suspended.

A recommended approach to obtaining car insurance without a license is to buy a policy and declare yourself as an excluded driver.

If you don’t have a driver’s license, you can still purchase car insurance by listing yourself as an excluded driver on the policy. Alternatively, you can opt for parked car insurance if you won’t be driving the vehicle. In case your license has been suspended, you can opt for SR-22 insurance. However, it’s important to note that if you do drive the car, none of these options will cover any damages incurred.

How to Get Car Insurance without a License

Here are some tips to get car insurance without a license:
  1. Purchase a policy where you are listed as an excluded driver
  2. Consider getting parked car insurance if you won’t be driving your car at all
  3. Get quotes from small and regional companies or contact a local independent agent who may be familiar with insurers that provide policies to unlicensed drivers
  4. Add a licensed driver as the co-owner of your vehicle on the registration to increase the chance of getting your vehicle insured
  5. If your license is suspended, get SR-22 insurance to reinstate your driving privileges and maintain comprehensive insurance to avoid a lapse in coverage.

Options to Get Auto Insurance for Unlicensed Drivers

While it is not required by law to have a driver’s license to obtain auto insurance, most insurance companies refuse coverage to unlicensed drivers.

Popular national insurers such as Geico, State Farm, Progressive, and Allstate typically do not provide quotes without a license, but a few companies like The Hartford do offer policies for unlicensed drivers.

To find coverage, it is recommended to seek out quotes from smaller or regional companies or contact a local independent agent who may have knowledge of insurers who provide policies for unlicensed drivers.

Keep in mind that when purchasing car insurance online, a valid license number is usually required, so contacting insurers directly may be necessary.

  • List yourself as an excluded driver

To obtain car insurance without a license, it is important to purchase a policy that designates you as an excluded driver. By doing so, the auto insurance company assumes less risk because they will not provide coverage for you or your vehicle if you happen to drive the car and get into an accident.

  • Update your Car’s Registration Information.

If you are having trouble finding an insurance provider due to your lack of a license, you could contemplate making a licensed driver the co-owner of your vehicle on the registration. This can improve your chances of obtaining insurance since vehicle ownership is typically a prerequisite. The process of changing the registration to reflect the new ownership is uncomplicated and often involves visiting your local DMV, submitting a form, and paying a fee.

  • Get Parked Car Insurance

To obtain insurance for your car while it’s parked and not being driven, you can consider getting parked car insurance. This type of insurance policy is designed for vehicles that are not being used for a certain period of time, such as during winter or when you’re out of town, and provides protection against theft, vandalism, and other risks.

It is not necessary to have a driver’s license for parked-car insurance as the insured vehicle will not be driven. This means that auto insurers may not require a license to provide coverage. Additionally, parked-car insurance policies are usually less expensive than standard auto insurance policies that provide liability coverage.

Can I Get Car Insurance with a Suspended License

If your driver’s license has been suspended, your options for auto insurance will be different from those who have never held a license or have had it revoked. Suspension of a license often results from a serious traffic offense, such as driving under the influence (DUI) or driving without insurance. Typically, to reinstate their driving privileges, the driver must obtain SR-22 insurance.

To save money while your license is suspended, you should consider getting parked car insurance or a nonowner policy instead of canceling your policy altogether. Maintaining comprehensive insurance can help you avoid a coverage lapse, which could lead to an increase in future insurance premiums and denial of coverage from reputable insurers.

Can I Buy a Car without a Driver’s License

Just like buying car insurance, you do not necessarily need a driver’s license to purchase a car. Nonetheless, without a license, test-driving the vehicle or driving it away from the dealership is not possible. Even if it is permitted, auto dealerships are often hesitant to provide financing to customers who lack a license. Your chances of securing a car loan without a license may improve if you approach a local bank that doesn’t require a license for this type of loan.

Can I Register a Car with No License

You do not always require a driver’s license to register a car. In many states, you can complete the registration process by submitting the necessary documents, paying the fee, and presenting proof of insurance to your state’s Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV).
